intro: Alsophila roquettei, commonly known as the Roquette's tree fern, is a species of tree fern native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyatheaceae and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and large, pinnate fronds. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, fertile soil. Its reproductive structures include sporangia that produce spores, which are dispersed by wind. Alsophila roquettei plays a role in tropical ecosystems by providing habitat and contributing to forest biodiversity.
